pages.title: Result Holder (Core)
pages.text: Crafting matrix consists of a result holder (matrix core) and several ingredient holders. Place the result holder first, with any facing you wants, and then place the ingredient holders to connect to it.$(br2)It's better to keep crafting matrices seperated, as if they detect each other, both will break.

pages.title: Ingredient Holder
pages.text: The crafting matrix will begin crafting once all ingredient holders are filled, crafting as much items as possible at once. Powering the core with redstone can pause crafting.$(br2)When an ingredient holder is disconnected from the result holder, it will break, dropping itself and contents as items.

pages.title: Filler
pages.text: If your recipe has disconnect parts, you can use filler item to fill them. Filler will not be consumed during crafting.$(br2)Look at the matrix core and you can see the crafting grid with items in them. The result holder will display with a cross. You can use $(l:concepts/a3_wands)rotate wand$(/l) to rotate the orientation of the grid.
